main event: A single orange-colored, lighted, and round object was observed from the ground at an altitude of approximately 2,000-3,000 feet. The object exhibited a pulsating motion and flickering effect.
interesting points: The object was tracked through binoculars and was visible for a period of 4-5 minutes.
The object moved erratically and finally disappeared from view at 2310 local on 6 June 1962.
The observer was an instructor and ground power officer at Chanute Air Force Base, who was generally considered reliable.
The weather conditions at the time of the sighting were high, thin, overcast skies with 12 miles of visibility.
There were no known flight operations at Chanute Air Force Base that could account for the sighting.
sighted object: single orange-colored, lighted, and round object
witnesses: A/2C James A. Ranch, instructor and ground power officer at Chanute Air Force Base
